definition: ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: And my sword in the worst fighting has broken.
sentences.chinese: 而我的剑在这次惨烈的战斗中已断。

sentences.english: We have really good competition now on the left with Insua, Aurelio and Dossena.
sentences.chinese: 我们左后卫的竞争很惨烈，小因，饼子和牛哥。

sentences.english: In the reality competition is the like this frigidity.
sentences.chinese: 现实中的竞争是如此的惨烈。

sentences.english: There was no more poignant victim of it than Marilyn Monroe.
sentences.chinese: 而玛丽莲梦露便是此种错误最惨烈的牺牲品。

sentences.english: Well-chosen policies that foster growth may make them less fierce.
sentences.chinese: 促进增长的适当政策或可缓和斗争的惨烈程度。

sentences.english: That's hard to do. This is an incredibly competitive market.
sentences.chinese: 这点很难做到，要知道，市场竞争可是异常惨烈。

sentences.english: After a strange sad war, great war for thee.
sentences.chinese: 为你经过一场奇怪而惨烈的力战。

sentences.english: And after a day of fierce fighting, he was forced to withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 经过一天惨烈的战斗后，麦克莱伦被迫撤离这一地区。

sentences.english: For a time, Bulq was listed as one of the casualties of that fateful battle.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔克一度被列为那场惨烈战斗的阵亡者之一。

definition: shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
(of competition or fighting) intense/fierce/(of pain) acute/(of an expression of opinion) impassioned/vehement/(of a course of action) drastic/extreme
spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
